channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Becoming a co-maintainer of a CPAN-module
item.description: Three new episodes in the series were re-published: Move packages to their own files, Finish Perl::Critic cleanup, set up Test::Perl::Critic, Eliminating indirect method calls. Enjoy, and support the Perl Maven by subscribing to the Perl Maven Pro

item.title: An extra space can ruin your day
NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: From Regular Expressions to Grammars, Pt. 3
item.description: Parsing JavaScript with Perl6 grammar. Fun!

item.title: Rewriting Mojolicious::Plugin::AssetPack
item.description: A rewrite of the asset-building Mojolicious plugin is in the wings. Come and see what changes Jan has in mind.

item.title: lcpan tips 008: Finding related modules
item.description: perlancar shares a cool thing the new mirror tool lcpan can do: it can peruses the documentation of all mirrored modules, and figure out which modules relate to each other based on their conjointed mentions in the same PODs.

item.title: Please test Path-Tiny-0.081-TRIAL
item.description: The trial version of the upcoming Path::Tiny release is available. If you are using Path::Tiny, you should give it a whirl, as there are incompatible changes coming down the pipe. And if you are not using Path::Tiny. You should. 'cause it's awesome.

item.title: Introducing Git::Version::Compare
item.description: Thought Perl was the only software out there with funky versioning? Ah! But that's okay: Git's own versioning maze now sport nice padded walls, thanks to BooK and Git::Version::Compare.

item.title: 3Party - cpan modules third party testing
item.description: melezhik is musing aloud about a potential new service that would provide black box-type integration testing for modules (as opposed to the unit testing that CPANtesters provides). Interested? Let him know!

item.title: Herding Camels
item.description: Yanick showcases how Git, Git::CPAN::Patch, App::GitGot and a small roll of script-fu can be used together to macgyver a testing infrastructure for inter-related code repositories.

item.title: Am I reinventing a wheel?
item.description: melezhik has written a plugin for his outthentic tool that reports and monitors disk usage. He is, however, wondering if he might not be reinventing the wheel. If so, he's also wondering if somebody could point him to any perl-based radial prior art.

item.title: Technology for automating deployments: the agony of choice
item.description: When there are no alternatives, you know exactly where you stand (in a canoe, floating in the middle of that well-known creek) and what need to be done (find a paddle, stat). But when the options are legions, they trigger decision paralysis. Moritz reviews a few of the many, many tools out there having to do with automated deployment (and shares which ones he's typically reaching for).

item.title: Tabletop.Events Built On Perl
item.description: Tabletop.Events is a new convention management platform built using Perl and AngularJS. As its name suggest, it's mostly geared toward board game conventions, but its set of features also makes it quite capable of managing other kind of conventions and conferences.

item.title: GitPrep 1.12 released - Catch up latest GitHub design
item.description: A new version of the locally-installable GitHub lookalike is out!

item.title: #239 - Of Tabletop and Desktop Games
item.description: This week, we see the emergence of a new convention/conference platform mostly geared toward boardgame conventions, from the fine folks who already brought us the GameCrafter. Plus a few articles dealing with testing. Plus the usual smattering of Perl6 and module releases. Enjoy! ~ `/anick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
